alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; Lander Foothills; Natrona County Lower Elevations; North Big Horn Basin; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southeast Johnson County; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 01 at 2:04PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Bitter Cold Temperatures for Wednesday and Thursday... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Temperatures falling to near zero tonight. A light breeze will cause wind chill temperatures to be -15 to -20 degrees. High temperatures Wednesday will only increase to the single digits to low teens. Low temperatures will be in the -10 to -20 degree range Thursday morning with wind chills as low as -25 degrees. * WHERE...Central Wyoming Basins. * WHEN...Tonight through Thursday Morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitter cold temperatures can be dangerous to people and pets. Bring your pets indoors. Bundle up and dress in layers. Frostbite and Hypothermia can set in quickly.
